intro: Moehringia intricata subsp. giennensis, commonly known as the Giennensis Moehringia, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in southern Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, commonly known as the carnation family. This subspecies is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
